description: I really enjoy coming here for some great Chinese food. It can be after the bar or before the bar they are always open. The one thing that I love the most here is the fried rice with some of their chili sauce. If you are ever in Polk don't miss out on this hidden gem. The owner is very friendly and remembers you every time you go in.
author: Poonam M.

description:
Whenever a restaurant has been in SF for a long time, my expectation is that the food would be good. With Wing Lum, this was a bad assumption.  I came here for dinner on a Sunday and ordered their seafood deluxe. I even upgraded - soup, appetizer and rice for $7.50 extra.  

The food here was not good - the soup was bland (and they gave me a lot of it), the egg rolls did not have a lot of filling and the seafood was overcooked (the shellfish was rubbery).  The veggies were OK.  The upgrade was not worth it. 

The service was consistent with what you'd expect for an ethnic place. With tax and tip, this was about $28. The restaurant itself was a bit dated.  Not recommended.
author: Andrew S.

description:
WING LUM. First of all, a mutual friend knew the people working at this restaurant, so a group of 8 of us walks in on a Saturday night at 1:30am right when they were about to close, but my friend insisted that we had to eat at this Chinese restaurant. When the restaurant employee saw my friend, his face changed from being hesitant to welcome arms. We got seated at this long table perfect for 8 people. I'll admit there was this shady individual at the bathrooms, but besides that, this place was the bomb.

The ambiance is very oriental feeling. They definitely tried to make the restaurant seem more Chinese with their painted walls and various Asian decor. They had wooden chopsticks and placed forks on the table for us. While I went to use the restroom, I was surprised to find out that my friends had ordered two of the following to be split between the two tables - General Tsao chicken, Mongolian beef, chow mein, and honey shrimp with cashews. Then I requested to order the twice cooked pork because that was what I was craving. The food came out pretty fast, probably because we were quite literally the only ones in there at 2am. 

I'm sure the food tasted even better since we spent the whole night drinking away at the bars on Polk Street, but it was so tasty! Somehow, we hooligans finished all the dishes (my side of the table quicker than the other). It was as if we inhaled the food from it being so delicious. I really liked the twice cooked pork flavors even though the pork isn't quite the typical twice cooked pork with it being crispy and all. It was kind of like a Mongolian beef texture. I've never had the honey shrimp with cashews before. It's usually candied walnuts with the honey shrimp, but it was a great substitute! That was a must order along with the twice cooked pork. The General Tsao surprisingly wasn't too breaded and it was very tangy with enough chicken meat to breaded ratio. 

Overall, I will come back here whether it's a late night Chinese craving or during the day. Great service and delicious food! Also, with a 20% tip, the total for 9 dishes came out to be about $16 per person! Great for groups!
author: Ada C.

description:
Terrible Service ever 
I went with my friend and we ordered Honey Walnut Prawns($14). However, a waiter changed and served cashew prawns ($9.25) without notice us, but he charged $14. He dose not listen to our words at all. You can go if you are confident with fighting a waiter or do not mind a price. However, I do not think the meals worth with the battle with waiter.....

今までで1番酷いサービスの店でした。エビとクルミ($14)を頼んだのですが、出たのは海老とカシューナッツ($9.25)で、何度言っても値段は変わらず$14払わされました。店員に対して立ち向かえるなら食べにいってもいいと思いますが、味もそんなに価値のある物とはとても思えませんでした。
author: Kura A.

description: Excellent food.  Most people will avoid this restaurant because of the appearance, but never judge a book by its cover.  (People who do, probably don't read much anyways).  I've eaten A LOT of Chinese food in my life so I can gauge H&S soup Mongolian Beef etc, and this place is a above average with average prices.  Recommend!
author: Azman H.

description:
THREE words NO FREAKING WAY!
OH AND MSG!

This food made us so sick it was unbearable.
I mean the whole house got sick eating at this place! 

NEVER AGAIN! 
Death would have been more merciful than eating here. 
I hate you Wing Lum and your evil food.
author: Milan F.

description: We were quickly seated. Our order was taken promptly. The food came out within 10-15 minutes. The only thing we passed on was the gelatinous egg flower soup. It looked snotty . We had salt and pepper pork chops, combo fried rice and mixed veggies sauteed in garlic sauce. It was delicious!
author: Raquel T.

description:
What do you want out of a Chinese food restaurant?
When you're tipsy?

Great food (yes)
Ample portions (yes)
Comfortable, casual atmosphere (yes)
Food comes out fast (yes)
Polite and prompt service (yes)

This place has it all.  No, it's not gourmet and doesn't feel very sophisticated.  Who cares?  This is just a terrific option after you slam a few glasses of wine at a free wine tasting (or whatever).
author: Karen r.

description: This food is absolutely fantastic and will definitely be coming back. They have the best egg flower soup in all of SAN Francisco, and the staff was super friendly. Do not believe the bad reviews here. Love this place
author: Jessica D.

description: The food is disgusting. We ordered fried rice that was bland, the Mongolian beef had a funky smell, it might have been an ingredient but it made it unideble. The onion pancake tasted like a fluffy omelette cover by a deep fried dough and the spring rolls were super mushy and tasteless. Never again
author: Annel K.

description: Ordered through postmates on NYE. Got food poisoning the morning after! We got the chow mein, fried rice, and hot and sour soup. They were delicious, sure, but it was definitely worth the pain. Great place to choose if you're looking for a challenge!
author: Muhammad H.

description: This place was recommended to us. Decor was fun, and loudly Chinese if that's a thing. Food was great! We had hunan general chicken and seafood delight. It was legit. Service was pushy and he couldn't really explain anything about the dishes. We asked what was in a dish and all we got was 'it's good, you'll like.' Couldn't or wouldn't say what it was. Quality of the dishes were great though and he was right, we did like it.
author: Walter L.

description:
Please ...! Do not eat at this filthy restaurant. 
I just felt there 
First I ask for ice water glass was gross I sent it back ! My Aunty crinnged. Ok I ordered curry chicken it tasted like moldy bread ! Sent it back. He recomenned beef and broccoli. I started to eat it it tasted much better than the moldy chicken all of the sudden I look inside my plate and I see a cockroach. I immediately screamed 
jumped up from my plate the waiter ran took the plate away as my aunt followed him to the kitchen and trying to take pictures he dumped the whole plate in the garbage can...! Omg really I have called health department hopefully someone calls me back asap. 
FYI I have never sent any food back in my life. Nasty !
author: juana p.

description: DELICIOUS. Kind and generous. Very satisfying. Best Chinese I've had on this block. Was going up the street to California (I hated it) and felt dumb passing this up so often. Great
author: Analouise S.

description: Just the place for some Chinese food, we enjoyed it all, thought had more dim sum but the fried wonton, egg rolls, pork veg, and the shrimp with a side rice was perfect for a party of 3. Bar hopping was great and found some action. We had good service too, they took care of us. Try it, it's Chinese food. Enjoy yourself
author: Alex M.

description:
Entered for the first time as my friend works nearby and was under the impression they knew him well. They did, they simply did not know his friend, me. Upon entering the let us seat ourselves regardless of the fact the sign said not to. Waiter comes to table, we order, he takes order...asks foer drinks we order beer. Beer shows in 15 mins. We wait 45 for our dinner. My friend, well aware his order was heard finally says, lets go and tells me exactly what he thinks of the place. It somehow changed in that hour. I simply walked past it, as it looks like a dump in and out, since 1993. I have no idea if was always there since 93, but I think it was...it looks, smells, and is the same as the day it was opened. The service, there is none.
The Final Insult....My friend simply wanted to leave and not pay they were so rude to us both. Instead I gave hima 10 on 8$ for 2 cheap beers, not in a glass, nor cold. He tried to poket my change, no he did. In his Pocket......I asked for my 2 dollars, gave him one. Last dollar this, I think its a restaurant? It ertainly fails to act like one. His excuse, being busy. The entire place was empty. Save few guys my pal knew from the Restaurant Bizz. Dump. Worked in more restaurants than I am stupid to pay for, kitchen , well Yikes!
Enjoy, perfect for Big Parties of people who cannot Cook. So I imagine they love it.
Staff and manner, Never the 2 Shall Meet.
Dig in!
author: Jonathan D.

description: The first time I tried this place out a couple months ago it was pretty decent. But the last two times I've had it since then have been bad. The chicken was literally inedible. It was hard and chewy and I couldn't swallow it if I tried. The BBQ pork fried rice is decent but after the chicken I questioned the state of the pork. They are generous portions so that's a bonus. Unfortunately I can't recommend this place and will be looking for Chinese elsewhere from now on.
author: Christopher J.

description: When you live in the tenderloin and crave late night Chinese, this will do in a pinch. Not the best tasting and definitely over priced.
author: Deanna E.

description: From the service to the price to the quality of the food. This place deserves 5 stars all the way around. I stopped in here and ordered the General Tsos chicken. This chicken was exceptionally good. The waiter offered me a cold brew for only 9$ that was like 2 pints worth! I ordered two of those ! ;) He also recommended I take the rice, soup, and egg roll up-charge of 7$ which I did and did not regret!
author: Justin M.

description:
What a surprise, this place is the bomb!

The food is great, the prices are right, and the people are super chill.
author: Nathan B.

description: I called them for a delivery order and after about five minutes of being on hold and then trying to explain my address to then, he told me they "didn't have a car" and so couldn't deliver to us. We're located 1.8 miles away and we got their menu because they put it on our front door.
author: Katherine Y.

description:
Howdy folks. This is by far my favorite Chinese restaurant in the city of San Francisco. I know that there are many Chinese restaurants in San Francisco that offer competition. But this establishment gets five stars from me which is significant because I don't pass out five stars generously. But Wing Lum deserves every bit of those five stars.
    Ok I know there are a lot of good Chinese restaurants out there. But there is usually something I don't like about them. The portions aren't big enough. They won't take the vegetables out of the fried rice(I don't do vegi's). The servers are unfriendly. Too over priced for what you get. Not here at Wing Lum. Everything from the quality and portions of the food served to the service and price is right on the mark with what a good Chinese restaurant should be. 
    Lets focus on the food right now. I'm sorry but nobody does it right like Wing Lum does it. As I mentioned in the previous paragraph, I do realize that there are a lot of good Chinese restaurants out there. Especially in a city like San Francisco. But no matter where I am at the moment, I will go out of my way to be able to eat at Wing Lum. I recommend their sweet and sour pork. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. Not only is it delicious but they give you a lot of it. By the time time you finish you will be full. :-) The great thing is it won't cost you an arm and a leg to get full either. 
    The same waiter always waits on me and my friend every time we go in there. He's always super friendly and very prompt with the service. You never have to get his attention for anything. That is the sign of a good waiter. He pays attention to his customers so they don't have to come to him for service. He's right on it. 
    I could go on and on saying good things about this place. But I think you all get the idea. Wing Lum is a groovey place to get some excellent Chinese food in the beautiful city by the bay. Alright! Yeah! Uhhhh!
author: Nathanial T.

description:
Curry beef- my test is to request it without vegetables and see if I get it without vegetables (beef and curry only- I'm an adult, I don't have to eat veggies). : )
Veggie test was a success and it was tasty curry with nicely cooked (read: tender) beef.
author: Johanna S.

description: I'm a fan! I visited for the first time tonight and am definitely surprised that it was so slow on a Saturday night but don't let that fool you. People are probably just too busy drinking in this neighborhood. Anyways, everything was delicious! I had the egg flower soup, fried prawns and the ginger onion fish. Everything was fresh and hot and delicious! Very nice atmosphere as well for dining!
author: Mel B.

description: Nice decor. Clean and quiet. Food is decent. Lunch special / rice plates are around $8-$9.
author: Foxy G.

description:
Fast and large portions. The restaurant decor is hilarious - feels like you are in a gift shop - however it has a charm to it. Share you food - each plate can feed 2. 
Has a good lunch special - that's what I got here.
author: Zita M.

description:
Used to get takeout from this joint back in the day.  Would get there in about 10-15 mins!  No joke!

Glad to see it's still around.
author: John T.

description: I don't write reviews but I ordered from this spot 2 times in a row and it's was just sub-par and not even good for leftovers. There's plenty of Chinese food in this city. Avoid this spot.
author: Travis L.

description: This place was awesome! The portions were a good size and the food was delicious. I especially loved the salt and pepper wings. Some of the best I had ever had! The owner was nice as well. Treated us like we were family. Great place!
author: Tammie S.

description:
I never thought I'd say it, but Wing Lum was the restaurant that saved Christmas!

My friends and I have an annual Dec. 25th tradition. We catch a matinee at the AMC Van Ness, and then we duck in to Mel's Diner next door for a bite to eat. Unfortunately, the line to get in to Mel's this year was out the door. We searched up and down Van Ness and Polk Street for a plan B. We pretty much heard an angel choir singing when we saw the Open sign at Wing Lum.

The decor of the place is pretty funky. Lots of fountains, pastel colors, plants, and weird ornaments (none of which really seemed to match). But we didn't care - we were hungry, and these guys were serving.

Normally, I'm leary of restaurants that have menus a with a long laundry list of food options. Wing Lum's menu is HUGE. They had over 244 choices (no joke) to select from. Since I was hungry and unfamiliar with the quality of the food, I decided to stick with tried and true Chinese favorites - pot stickers and chicken fried rice. My friends order the prawn fried rice and the no-fried lemon chicken (which is a cute way of saying tofu). Everything turned out to be just fine. The pot stickers were a bit on the doughy side, but the pork filling was tasty. Plus, we got 8 in our order, so it was easy to share. You're lucky to get six pot stickers per order at most restaurants. My chicken fried rice was also decent. The chicken and veggies were plentiful. The rice was a bit on the greasy side, but it all tasted good.

Prices are reasonable. Service is efficient. Thanks, Wing Lum for saving our Christmas!
author: Kevin B.

description:
I work the graveyard shift at a nearby hotel and we always order from here. Open late and occasionally deliver late too. Food is tasty especially the lemon pepper pork and pork chow mien. People are extra friendly and through in a little extra "sumptin sumptin" since we order for a big group. We recommend this place to all of our guests looking for some late night eats. 

PS: probably tastes like heaven when you are drunk.
author: Alfredo R.

description: Another great find for dinner near my hotel in Nob Hill. While the place has some funky...maybe even tacky decorations, don't let that detract you from coming here. The server was super attentive while still feeling very homey and cozy as if we walked into his house and he was trying his best to be the perfect host. We ordered the lemon chicken and the chicken egg foo yung. The food came faster than expected and you could tell it was freshly prepared. The food was great and for the price we got a huger portion. Definitely glad we stopped here for dinner.
author: Allie S.

description: hidden gem! authentic Chinese food! open pretty late too! such a cute atmosphere! everything is delicious! very happy I found this place. I ordered chicken chow mein which was amazing, won ton soup, szchuan chicken and fried rice! everything was great! waiter was very nice! out of 100s of Chinese places glad I found this one!
author: Christina C.

description: bomb vegetarian. sweet and sour meatless chicken hella good! great service. will be eating here again!
author: Frank A.

description: Don't ever order from this place.  They will charge you for things you never ordered and then refuse to refund you for their mistake.  The kitchen area looks pretty filthy too.  Wish I'd just walked out instead of letting myself be taken advantage of.
author: Rose B.

description: This place is exceptional. We came in last night late and starving. The service we received was unbelievable. We barely had to lift a finger. The place was really cool and the ambiance was nice. Oh and the food, best Chinese food hands down I've ever had!
author: Jennifer G.

description: So i love there Won Ton Soups and  there pot stickers. I work a few blocks away and always use them when im sick  and just want to munch on something.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Really amazing food!

The prices are a bit high but normal for the area and the amount of food you get and the quality is well worth it. Friend rice and noodles are some of the best I've had and there general Tso is really tasty and fresh. Skip the egg rolls though, kinda bland and lacking in anything in the inside.
author: Clinton C.

description:
Tl;dr version: Best Sweet & Sour Chicken in the known universe
----
"That's enough!" you yell at your henchman. He pauses mid-strike, glances at you, nods, and re-holsters the Glock 9 he was using to pistol-whip who seems to be the lead physicist of the group. 

You've taken over the Large Hadron Collider in Geneva, Switzerland, the world's largest and most powerful particle accelerator ever created. Since this device can smash subatomic particles together and reproduce the energies that existed a fraction of a second after the big bang, along with creating Z bosons, pi mesons, and the strange quarks that construct the fabric of the universe, you are pretty certain that you can use this thing to make the best Sweet and Sour Chicken of all time and dimensional spectrums. 

"What's your name?" you ask the battered scientist.

"Christoph. Christoph Virdee. Please. I have two kids. I just want to go home. What you are asking is not even possible. I wouldn't even know where to begin. You want to make Sweet and Sour Chicken as you imagine it would taste like if you were an extra in John Carpenter's "Big Trouble in Little China" in the 1986 version of San Francisco's China Town? It's insanity! There's no way to calibrate that. No way at all! This is not even remotely possible. This machine does not work like...," you shoot him in the forehead. 

"Would anyone else like to tell me why this will not work?" you ask the twenty or so scientists you've taken hostage. You are genuinely asking for their advice because you are starting to second guess your plan but you kind of get why no one is responding, given that you just shot that dude. "I am never going to eat a goddamn weed brownie again," you think to yourself, reflecting on the increasingly absurd situation you have got yourself into for the purpose of getting decent Sweet and Sour Chicken. Shake it off. 

"It's time," you tell Matt Reaver, the head of your freelance group of armed thugs. 

"Signing up to be a Task Rabbit has ruined my life," Matt thinks to himself, as he drops a live chicken, 1 cup cornstarch, 2 eggs beaten, 3 tablespoons light brown sugar, 1/2 cup white distilled vinegar, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 teaspoon garlic salt, and 1 cup canned pineapple chunk into the Large Hadron Collider. 

"Yes!" you hiss, as the ingredients collide at 7 teraelectronvolts per nucleon. Time, space, and matter fold infinitely onto itself, and in the nanoseconds of a cosmic clap, the universe and existence as we can faintly comprehend it cease being. 

6 BILLION YEARS LATER...

"I told you Wing Lum has the best Sweet and Sour Chicken ever made!' you tell your roommate, Matt, as you eat dinner in the restaurant.

"It is the best," he sighs. He looks distraught. "I just can't shake this feeling. Like, what do you call it? Déjà vu? It...I don't know. It's the most delicious Sweet and Sour Chicken I've ever had, but...it tastes kind of like...doom...if that makes any sense."

"Fuck no it doesn't!" you yell, as the weed brownie you ate earlier starts to kick in and your eyes roll wildly around in their sockets. "Hydroman collaborator!" you blurt out, not knowing why. The impression of a laughing crow's skulls fills every single piece of your brain matter, exploding through your fragile dendrites and killing you instantly. Your head hits the table and Matt vomits. 

In the immeasurable slimmer of time that takes place between your corporeal existence ending and the transcendence of soul to universe, you hold audience to the incomprehensibly powerful being that has taken the form of a crow's skull.

"You have much to atone for," the ancient god from forgotten dimensions transmits to you. "Your concept of pain is but a feather's touch to the horrors I shall impart on you." 

Billions of years of reincarnation open to your mind's eye and you recall a time eons ago where you destroyed the entire universe.

"Oh shit!" you gasp. "Did I end all of existence to try to make Sweet and Sour Chicken?" 

"Yeah," he says. "It was kind of a dick move." He glances around uncomfortably. 

"I'm sorry about that," you say. "You can tell I'm lying, huh? That I'm not really sorry."

"Yeah," he mumbles. "It was, I mean, that was just really, really unnecessary. I just kind of don't get it." 

"To be honest, that was a pretty weird period of time in my life, I was super into weed brownies, and it just made me make some really bad decisions." Pull the weed brownie from your cosmic ghost pocket and take a bite. Don't break eye contact with the crow's skull while chewing.

"Seriously dude? Seriously?" the all-powerful deity asks in disbelief, as you bite off more than the recommended serving. "Not cool man."
author: Dave G.

description: Waiter was extremely kind and attentive to us. The food came fast and was SOOO good. Don't mind the funny decorations, this place is great!  We intentionally didn't check yelp before we came in because you guys are all assholes. I plan on coming back many times.
author: Jacqueline D.

description: We found this place just by walking around the city. The food was extremely delicious, very tasty! They also have great service, the server was very helpful. This place deserves more stars than it currently has.
author: Nataly Michelle M.

description:
Really friendly guys who run this joint, and you know what? Good customer service counts for something in the restaurant industry, especially the Chinese one--they make sure everything is right, and recognize their repeat customers accordingly.

They customize pretty much everything on the menu to your liking--spicy? Yep. Pork instead of chicken? Okay! Extra sauce/pork/green onion? No problem!

This is the only Chinese restaurant I go to anymore. I would have deducted them a star for not having Eat24, but I find that hardly fair, as these guys work really hard and make the best CHINESE AMERICAN food in the area (nothing exotic, everything familiar, comfortable, and tasty).

My favorite Chinese place in the city. A really mixed crowd--Chinese, a lot of Mexicans, Russian Americans like me, etc.
author: Stevie D.

description:
Family of six
Had wonton soup fantastic
Eggs rolls were over cooked
Sweet and sour chicken dish wiped clean
Chicken wings plate finished
Chow mien hardly touched as the portions were quite large and Mongolian beef which we took home we were full.
Not as cheap as I thought but consider each dish we didn't really touch was 10 each 10 bucks a head for good food I think is a good deal.
author: David C.

description:
So first time i ordered from here i ordered a dinner special 
It came fast and was cheap 
Two egg rolls sweet n sour and soy sauce
One big soup sweet n sour and really good
Rice
Meatless chicken 
Fortune cookie 
They forgot the tea
Second i called on Saturday and tried to order a lunch. Special but i forgot that is m-f
He said no. Prob
Again fast and cheap 
Wonton strips sweet n sour sauce soy sauce 
Cutlery napkins 
Small sweet n sour soup not as good this time but still good this time the color was more yellow than pink-red
Tofu over rice with veggie hot and delicious
Meatless salad creamy!!
I will order from here again
author: Jennifer G.

description: This may not be so authentic but the flavor of our orders was very nice and fit the bill on a day where outpatient surgery left us looking for lunch around 3:30pm.  The food was quick, hot and tasty.  Had the pork with green beans and the beans were fresh and crunchy, cooked perfectly.  The portion was very good.
author: Stu W.

description:
I love this place -- it's not gourmet food by any stretch of anything, but a great old-style Chinese-American family restaurant.  This is the traditional fare, tasting just like it did 50 years ago -- such memories.

Service is good, though I'm usually there late-nite when traffic is light.  Staff exemplary -- they treat you like honored guests every time.  Neighborhood is, well, don't look out the window and you'll be fine.  Truly one of my favorite spots in all of SF.  The day they go out of business I will cry for a week.
author: Captain A.

description:
The guy was nice, but the black bean fish was made entirely of msg and the garlic eggplant tasted entirely syrupy. 

Also they forgot our tea and couldn't get the food out at the same time, despite the fact that the only other patrons had already been served

In a hilarious cherry on the top of the Sunday of awfulness that was our experience, the fortune cookies were not in wrappers and mine was missing its fortune. 

Someone stole my fortune dangit!  There will be heck to pay.
author: Lucas W.

description:
I am going to tell you, Johnny opened his doors after closing to feed 4 very hungry people. Four of us knocked on Wing Lum's door at nearly 3 AM after drinking most of the night. Without hesitation, he invited us in. 

I don't know if this is standard, and personally I wished it were. But because he did the world needs to know of his open warmheartedness. 

I would have given 5 stars if I could have even smelled the food, damn whiskey.
author: Tony W.

description: This isn't the cheapest but its really reasonable (under $10 for lunch specials) and everything is so good! The honey walnut shrimp are SO GOOD. Also the dining area is so cool! Tucked away you won't even realize you're right off of Polk. We live in the neighborhood and love it! Plus the guy who works there is awesome.
author: Erin A.

description:
The Rainman that I spoke to on the phone refused to deliver anywhere further than "5 seconds away." Their food is awful and so are their people.

Thanks Wing Lum.
author: Alex H.

description: I love this place and have been coming here for about 10 yrs.. Love the owner and his employees they are all VERY nice.. When my parents come to visit from Mexico and my sister from Chicago they all ASK for Wing LUM.. They all remember and love this place, they have said this is the best Chinese food they have ever had.. YUMMY..
author: Alejandra P.

description:
You know, I was not expecting much from this place but was pleasantly surprised. Service was pretty slow on a Sunday for lunch but not too bad. There was just one server, I think he was a grandfather, Also he got one of our orders wrong (combination fried rice) and convinced us we had received a better dish than the one we ordered LOL. 
Anyways, if you're hungry for some American Chinese food, this place is not bad. We had the General Tso chicken, Stir Fried Green Beans, Fried wontons, and Combination fried rice. The appetizer wontons were a little too fried but the rest of the items were all good, esp the beans. I'll come back.
author: Vol T.

description: Wing Lum is my favorite casual Chinese place in San Francisco.  Food quality is very good, service is friendly, they deliver, and they are open late.  What more could you ask for?
author: Charlie G.

description:
I love the atmosphere! The people are soooo nice. The guys in here told us to take our time, hang out as long as we want. My sister and I ordered the veggie egg foo young and meatless lemon chicken. And a beer and a soda.

Yes, it was pricier - nearly $8 an entree. I highly recommend the veggie egg foo young. NOT a fan of the meatless lemon chicken. It was synthetic lemony tasting and had a funny texture. 

For a good dining atmosphere, great wait staff and tasty veggie dishes (stay away from the meatless), I recommend Wing Lum.

They're open til 1 am every night!
author: Em L.

description: This place should be five stars across the board with the exception of street parking. John takes care of everyone and you always get the famous fortune cookie at the end. Dine in. Carrie out or delivery. They are consistent, quick and most of all GOOD AS HELL. If it's Friday night and you are out with friends having some drinks they will even deliver to the bar you are at. Cash or credit card. Just make sure you tip O.G. on the bicycle who delivers your stuff. Oh yeah. If you need extra soy sauce, hot sauce or whatever make sure you let John know when you phone in your order. Otherwise your outta luck Chuck. Better luck next time.
author: Dookie B.

description:
I can't for the life of me can't figure out why this is 3.5 stars. 

I'm never disappointed and find myself usually leaving with a smile. Staff is nice, laid back. 

It is really good all around for the type of restaurant it is....if you know what I mean. 

Food is delicious and consistent. Generous portions. Great flavor. 

Fantastic job guys!
author: Jason L.

description:
OMG! Just thinking of Wing Lum salt and pepper fish has got my mouth watering. 

Came here once on a recommendation from the bartender at Blur. Now its my go to on all Polk St. drinking nights. A little pricey, but generous portions and...did I mention the salt and pepper fish!!!???

The décor is really interesting and sure to kick the imagination of a Friday night drunk.
author: Cassie C.

description: I'm not sure what part of China these people are from . They are definitely not from the part that makes good food. I ordered chicken w green beans and beef with broccoli . It was sour and the egg drop soup had no flavor . I would say this is the worst Chinese food I ever ate . I have had the best Chinese food in New York in china town and even the most crappy food in New York is better than this.
author: Wade B.

description: We've been here twice now and will definitely be back! The menu has a good selection. The food is delicious and not overpriced. From the outside, this place may not look the greatest, but inside is peaceful and interesting. Wing Lum is a nice place to stop to dine and avoid the chaos of the busy street outside.  :-)
author: Craig W.

description:
Pretty stoked on this place!

Portions were faaaaat and the food was pretty good.  They're open late too which is chill.

I came here areound 11pm after the last night of Outside Lands 2013 and was dying for some wonton soup.  Good 'ol Wingy hooked it up with a bowl and served us in the traditional chinese style, with one hand behind his back and in a bow-like manner.

There was just one old asian guy running the place, there were some cooks in the back, but he was doing it himself on the floor.

The kung pao was very different, so was the house chicken.  Not quite 5 star worthy... but the price sure was! $7.50 a pop.

I would have gone ahead and given this place 5 stars but we were literally waiting 45 min for Mr. Lum to bring us our soup and then another 30 after that for the food...

Not cool Wing Lum!
author: Ryan W.

description:
I came here for lunch with my Mom over the weekend for a quick bite. I can't speak to anything other than the vegetarian won ton soup, but I loved it. It was healthy, delicious and the service was just as it should be. 

The decor is a little fun and crazy. I was worried that more people weren't there, because I really love seeing restaurant's thrive. 

I thought i had been everywhere on Polk street, so was excited to find another gem I will go back to.
author: Danielle V.

description: Poor customer service. Wanted to add to my order but he said it was too late since he already charged it. They clearly didn't want my business! There are so many other places in the area, find them! To add insult to injury, I got home to find out it wasn't what I ordered. I can't!!!
author: Ken B.

description: I ordered a chicken and brocolli. Horrible! I requested white meat and it was chewee and with lots of fat. Left the plate there, paid and got out to eat some tacos.
author: Mano M.

description:
Wing Lum is hit-or-miss.

The portions are large and there are a lot of vegetable dishes.  They seem to be a little spare with the meat and generous with the vegetables.  I don't care for bamboo shoots or water chestnuts and tend to end up with too many of each no matter what I get.  The sauces are a bit on the starchy side, but there are some hard-to-find Chinese dishes on the menu.

The waiter who always serves my food is an interesting character -- he always tries to push beer or something which for some reason seems unusual to me in this context.

I love the Barbie™ pony you can see as you walk in the door. Nice touch.
author: Dharbigt M.

description: The place has a nice decor, but that's the best part about it. Overall the food was very bland. I ordered sichuan chicken, which is supposed to be spicy but I couldn't taste anything. My buddy got bean curd soup which was like water, and another bland vegetable dish. I wouldn't come back here, drunk or otherwise.
author: M L.

description: I noticed I seem to like all the dirty chinese food places people hate.. not just in SF either. Maybe it's cause being chinese, I don't expect much in terms of sanitation or service from these restaurants. My takeout was delicious. Salt and pepper wings, fried rice, soup. All were salty and oily as they should be. NOM and they're open late so I can pretty much get my fix 24/7.
author: Emily H.

description:
Let's just say that Wing Lum wasn't my first choice when my friend and I were picking a spot for a quick dinner on a late Wednesday night.  In fact, it wasn't any of my choices, but I wasn't in a mood to argue.

Wing Lum serves the same Chinese food that every Chinese restaurant serves.  Chicken, pork, or beef, with sauce that is either dark or light brown, and spicy, sweet, or spicy-sweet.  That makes 18 different choices, most of which probably taste the same despite their nominative differences.

I doubt I'll be back, but truth be told, the food was perfectly fine though entirely predictable.  Chinese food is kinda done, isn't it?
author: Laurence W.

description:
Disgusting dim sum. I ordered the combo for $9 and got about 8 pieces of soggy AND hard dim sum. There was one I can only describe as a yellow cube of hard rubber. The shrimp dumpling was a soggy mess that fell apart.

This place is a total rip off for dim sum.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Inexpensive Chinese food, and open late.. it makes an A-ok combo for late night dining, but probably not for lunch or dinner. 

Pawns with honey wrapped walnut - decent size shrimp and not too much mayo 
beef chow fun - unexpected this was surprisingly good; the noodle has the right texture and flavor 
Salt pepper pork chops - nothing wow but typical S&P pork chop 
bean curd with mushroom - the tofu was sour, yuck
author: Coco L.

description:
We came here one night because we were at a bar nearby and got hungry. At first this place seemed like it would be kind of pricey and not very good because the decorations were too nice for a legit, late night Chinese restaurant.  

However, the food wasn't bad and decently priced. Take in mind though that it's not really "drunk" food since it's not super greasy or heavy. The chicken wings here are actually very good, but could use a little more spice. I got the West Lake Beef soup, which was tasty but a little overwhelming because it had so much beef and egg in it.
author: Margaret R.

description:
I couldn't decide whether to give a 3 or a 5...

The first time I ate this food, I ate at the restaurant. My fiance and I ordered pot stickers, chicken fried rice, and chow mein. It was all delicious and huge portions. The restaurant had a cute, nice feeling to it and the wait staff were all extremely friendly. We left extremely satisfied and swore we would be back soon. Five stars. 

The second time I ate here, we ordered in. I had been craving sesame chicken for the past week and got excited when I remembered how delicious Wing Lum Cafe had been. I was extremely disappointed when I got my meal. Instead of a saucy sesame chicken, I got a box of super dry, hard chicken and a small bowl of sauce. I HATE THAT. Even through my attempts of fully saturating the chicken, it still tasted like dry chicken nuggets that I had dipped in dipping sauce. Not ideal. Also, the sauce was surprisingly spicy. Granted, I am not a fan of spicy food but this was so spicy, I ended up my fiance's meal instead of my own. I'm sure the meal would have been better had it been served in the restaurant but still, I was disappointed and will probably never order delivery from them again. Three stars.

Five star @ the restaurant + 3 stars delivered= 4 total stars. My advice? Eat in!
author: Katelyn E.

description: Came here for some take out and was not disappointed. I ordered the general's chicken made extra spicy and it was perfect. The restaurant is a little kitschy but it's decent Americanized Chinese food. I'll definitely be back to try some other items.
author: Greg J.

description:
I walk by Wing Lum almost every day and it always looks empty so I figured it probably wasn't good.

I was wrong! This place is amazing! Went today (Sunday) for lunch:

The order:
* Vegetarian spring rolls = A+. Very crispy on the outside, with delicious, warm veggies on the inside. The sauce was excellent as well.
* Extra Spicy General Tso's Prawns = A+. The sauce was thick and savory, the perfect level of spice. The prawns were larger than average, meaty and perfectly fried--nice and crispy. Steamed broccoli was ok.
* Mu shu pork= B. Generous portion and overall a nice taste, but the pork seemed a bit overcooked. Good pancakes and hoisin sauce.

Service:
* The server sat us immediately and brought water and asked for drinks. We had hot tea, fairly standard. He came by with egg drop soup on the house, which was pretty good. We didn't ask for rice, but he brought it anyway. The spring rolls came right out to us steaming hot. Shortly after we got the main courses, which were hot and presented nicely. Waiter came by often to refill water. Check came at the right time.

The whole bill was $32 for two people, including tip. Plenty of food for leftovers.
author: Aaron E.

description:
This place is awesome! I've had the opportunity to eat here three times now despite living in SoCal and will always make a trip back here whenever I'm up in the bay. Very good food in a clean place for a great price! Neighborhood can be a bit shady at times. Despite it being a quick walk from my car to the restaurant, on the way to Wing Lum two different people tried selling crack to me in a 3 minute span haha. But there's usually close parking so doesn't matter too much.

Parking was not a problem each time I've gone (weekdays/weekends around lunch time) and I've never had to wait to be seated. The Hunan General Chicken is definitely my absolute favorite although the Kung Pao Chicken, Chicken with String Beans and the Mongolian beef were all also great! Huge serving portions that only cost $11 per person including tax and tip! I've brought different friends here on a few occasions hyping it up each time and it's always lived up to the hype, would definitely recommend at least giving it a try you won't regret it!
author: Christopher S.

description:
Found the decor of this place kinda creepy. It had an aquarium, TONS of plants, all sorts of chinese artifacts hanging on the walls and ceilings, and kinda dim lighting.. other reviews show me that some people actually appreciate such an eclectic decor.. I personally found it really crowded and stuffy.
Ordered takeout.. rice + some tofu dish.. didn't like it a lot.. was really dry and a little on the inedible side. I am vegetarian, maybe I would have liked this place if I had access to most of the menu (which is not vegetarian).
author: Aditya M.

description:
We're a little hungry and it's 1am on Christmas Eve, making it technically Christmas morning. Is there any hope for finding a dine-in restaurant serving tasty ethnic food ... on Christmas morning? 

Wait, does that neon sign say open? Does that other sign say dim sum? Hmm, it looks cute too. 

It's a Christmas miracle! 

We ordered the dim sum combo and sake. Perfection. Every dumpling and bun was savored, and nothing was left behind. 

And what nice service! A perfect balance of friendliness, support and encouragement. That's pretty much all you need in life. They didn't even pressure us to leave when it was nearing 2am and we had long finished our meal. 

Also, this restaurant has an eclectic look that I really appreciate and enjoy -- part tropical rain forest, part traditional Chinese decor, a dash of corny holiday lights and zesty orange walls. For some reason, I felt like I was on a Seinfeld set. I loved it. 

This could be a new Christmas eve tradition!
author: Rosie M.

description: Absolutely disgusting! worse chinese food I've ever had, to the point where I had to throw away my sweet and sour prawns.  Ordered a take out, what I got was stale overheated food! And the takeout box seemed dirty..ewwww!!
author: Snoopy C.

description: Went here today and was pretty impressed with the food! Decent serving, I had some to take home, decent- not amazing- prices, okay service, good atmosphere. Overall solid for good, high-quality chinese food. I got the vegetarian chow mein and really enjoyed it, and my friend got their beef chow fun and it was absolutely delicious.
author: Cecilia A.

description: This place is a dump! Let's put it this way! It's dead and there food isn't that great. I'm Chinese and wanted some real Chinese food for lunch. I wanted home away from home and this place is a fucking joke! It's so dead I can hear a couple of tables next to me fart and talk. I visit this restaurant a month ago. You bet your ass I'm not coming back here! Ps. This place gives you little food for the price you pay and there's more veggie than meat on my plate. If you come here to eat here, you must be blind and lost your taste buds!!
author: Gladys L.

description: This place is pretty tucked away and secluded, which is too bad because it has a cute kitschy interior that I find enjoyable. However, service is spotty. There was no greeting at the door or anything, literally walked in and stood around for a good while before people realized we were there. Tea is complimentary, but incredibly watered down. I may as well have been drinking plain hot water. The lunch specials are a good deal. Prices and portions are great, but I've had better food. We got some little bits of fried wonton wrappers as a complimentary appetizer. The hot and sour soup was great. I liked it a lot. The spicy eggplant with garlic sauce was totally not what I expected. I expected large juicy, purple, tender pieces of eggplant, but instead got deep fried strips of eggplant. It looked like the fried wonton wrappers, except drenched in sauce. The lunches come with a large amount of rice.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
It's rainy, cold and windy.  Not wanting to leave our hotel, we tried to find a place that would deliver at 11:30pm.  It was pizza or Wing Lum.

Wing Lum was yummy!

*Chicken Fried Rice
HUGE PORTION!

*Chicken Won Ton Soup
LOTS!  Delicious!

*General's Tso's Chicken
Very good!

The food arrived HOTTTTTTT and the poor guy was drenched from the rain.  Gave him a nice tip for getting the food there in 20 minutes and having it piping hot on a cold night.

Would definitely order from them again.

The only down side?  Our hotel room didn't have a microwave for the leftovers the next day.
author: Lindsey B.

description: Lord, please protect me from my curiosity. I knew that this place was terrible before I went in, but I was compelled anyway. Seeing a patron argue with the gruff, apparently overworked waiter twice (the place was basically empty), attempting to eat the over-sauced, overcooked chicken dish and having my eyes beaten senseless by the atrocious decor was enough for me to beg the Heavens for protection.
author: Richard B.

description:
This place is really good. They were empty on a Sunday afternoon in the crowded Polk district so they gave us the "lunch specials" anyways(supposed to only be on weekdays). For $6 or $7 bucks each we got 2 huge plates of rice and chicken(kung pao and hunan general). The kung pao was really spicy and delicious and the general chicken was also very good, although a tad bit "saucy". Our lunch special also came with a cup of delicious egg-drop soup. I was literally stuffed upon exiting. 

The decor here is crazy. You feel like you are in a jungle. The lady(probably the owner) was super nice and happy to have us there. I will definitely be back, at least for delivery.
author: Andrew T.

description:
This is a review for the dim sum only. I wasn't expecting much from this restaurant, but was at least expecting semi-decent reheated har gaw. What I got instead was a congealed glutinous mass of nastiness that wasn't even close to edible. Even fresh, this dim sum would have been a travesty, the skim was super thick and doughy and there was exactly one shrimp per dumpling.  Too bad, I really wish there was decent dim sum in this neighborhood - looks like I'll have to keep driving to the Richmond or walking all the way to Chinatown.

For what it's worth, I can't imagine that their standards are that high for their regular menu. I'll stick to Wok Shop any day.
author: Kamini T.

description:
Still pretty good chinese food...

minus two stars for two things:

i ordered Honey Walnut Chicken.....what i got was Honey CASHEW Chicken...
in all fairness they were probably slammed (IT WAS CHRISTMAS DAY) and ran out of walnuts and substituted cashews...i was pretty stoned when i ordered and probably sounded like it and they didn't think i would notice...i did! 

secondly...the delivery driver barely spoke English and couldn't figure out how to use the intercom to buzz up....

again...i was super stoned and really enjoying my Fortress of Solitude...and didn't want to throw on pants and run down the the cold lobby.   

i bet delivery drivers see a lot of stoned dudes in their underwear....so therefore i am giving you one star back!!!
author: Ripley B.

description: Great hours but parking around the area is terrible on a Sat night. We ordered shrimp dumplings and shumai for appetizers and at $6 each I was quite disappointed. They appeared to be the frozen kind. The skin of the dumplings were torn and soggy. Boo. We ordered the fresh vegetable entree which was delicious. The hot and sour soup is actually one of the better ones I have had. And we ordered black bean sauce prawns which was much too salty and came with only 10 prawns mixed in with tons of green bell peppers and onions to make the dish appear full. That being said, it is a late night restaurant which is why it got 3 stars from me. The owner seemed nice but also charged us $2.50 for tea which has not been standard practice in Chinese restaurants.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I love this restaurant we have been coming here for years... and not once have we had a bad experience. The quantity and the prices are great and if you order a certain amount of food they always gives us an extra plate. We dine in early, evening, very late and NEVER had a bad experience.. :)

And.... as time continues to go by we will continue to come back...

WE ARE OBSESSED WITH WING LUM!
author: Alejandra M.

description: Wing lum has been the destination of choice for my family for 10+ years when it comes to Chinese food. This place has great tasting food and the waiters there are very helpful. The decor and bathrooms have changed for the better, and it's open late. We always get a free plate or two on the house. This is your no frills place to chow down.
author: sam c.

description:
This place is legit. Granted the food certainly wasn't the best I've ever had, and I was drunk, so my opinion might be slightly weighed, but seriously, it hits the spot after last call. 

Extra points for polite, attentive service, being open late, having plenty of vegetarian/vegan options, being totally flexible with menu ingredient requests and giving us tons more fortune cookies after we ate ours and wanted more.
author: Natalye R.

description: I thought the food was pretty much right on with tastes you get in China. Food portions were huge.
author: Tanuki T.

description:
So, I live 2 blocks from this place, and have been eating here occasionally for the last  year and a half, and this is my first review... here's what happened.

First of all, eating at the restaurant has never worked out for me.  Both times I went the place was EMPTY and yet my friend and I had to wait about 30 mins for someone to take our order, then another 30 mins for our food and then eventually when we gave up on waiting for the check we'd go ask for it and head out.  The worst was when people would get seated next to us (in the empty restaurant) and then they would get their food before we'd ever order and leave before we'd ever get our food!

Needless to say, I stick with take out.  However tonight I tried delivery for the first time (yes, we're exceptionally lazy today... but its "free delivery"!) and that didn't work out at all!

I called in my order: orange peel beef, chicken fried rice, potstickers and fried wontons.  There is a coupon on the takeout menu for free chicken fried rice for orders over $20, and the pre tax total according to the menu was 20.75 without the rice.  So my first mistake was not specifying that I wanted to use the coupon, which in hindsight would have saved much time, but I figured I'd just explain to the delivery guy about the coupon and its all good.  WRONG.  He shows up and tells us the total is $31+ because we got Kung Pao Chicken.  NOPE.  Definitely never would have ordered that because of my peanut allergy.  So my bf explains to the guy that we never ordered that and he says we get it free because of the coupon for orders over $25... Ok, so we call the restaurant and explain that we definitely don't want the Kung Pao and ask to just pay for the rest... after passing the phone back and forth (it was more humorous than anything else) they finally agree to take the Kung Pao back and our total is $24.  Fine, whatever.  He left the coupon on the floor.

We sit down and pull out the food and my bf starts eating the orange peel beef... definitely chicken.  WTF.  At least my rice and sides were excellent.

Why 2 stars: They definitely have the best chicken fried rice ever and the prices are fantastic.  Everything I order is excellent.  I just wish they could not pull weird shady business by throwing in "free" items and charging more and then mess up everything anyway...

Lesson learned: stick with walking in and ordering takeout, order elswhere for delivery or dine-in.  The food is quite excellent, cheap, ready fast and you don't have to deal with anyone.  :)
author: Katie S.

description:
My favorite Chinese restaurant in San Francisco is House of Chen.
With that said...

One late night House of Chen was closed as it was past 11:30PM  (house of Chen closes @11) and I made the horrible decision I regret to this day to order from Wing Lum since this was open until midnight. My friends have been here already and even though I've only heard nothing but bad things about this DUMP, I was so desperate for Chinese I was forced to give it a try. BIG REGRET!

I called to place an order for delivery here in the Castro where I live and they said they didn't deliver that far? Understandable. So I decided to go ahead and order for pick. My order was just one chicken fried rice and a scallion pancake, I drive all the way to Wing Lum, pick up my over prized food, being helped by a very rude employee. Get back in the car and drive all the way back home. Set up the table, turn on the TV and finally open the box... and what do i find????? A COLD SOUP WITH WHITE STEAMED NASTY RICE!!!! WTF???? They totally messed up my order!

I called back immediately very pissed at this point, the guy who answered said they could not refund me, and not only that but it was also too late for them to cook my CORRECT food again??? No further compensation other than come back here and we "may" give you half off and NO apology... WHAT!

They are BY FAR THE WORST RESTAURANT, with awful food (I took a sip of that soup and it gave me the runs the next day) and WITH THE WORST AND LOWEST CUSTOMER SERVICE IN THE CITY!

STAY AWAY!
author: NC B.

description:
I actually love this place. Me and a friend end up here a lot for an after drinking meal, which is far better than eating a greasy slice of pizza. The wait staff is awesome and the food is good. The usual dishes for us are the Honey Walnut Shrimp, Honey Wrapped Chicken, and the Meatless Chicken with Vegetables.

I can't really complain about anything here at all.
author: Aaron M.

description:
You know how you get bad Chinese and if you drown it with enough soy, chili oil or something it is edible.  Well this is not that kind of Chinese.  I have to say it was awful.  We ordered 4 dishes and all were bad.  The veggies were burnt in all the dishes.  The eggplant was unrecognizable, burnt, rubbery and inedible.  All the dishes were too thick from too much cornstarch, leaving nothing to put on the rice; which was way overcooked.

On the plus side the beef was tender (with burnt veggies and tofu), but tasted too awful to eat much; same for the chicken with broccolli.
author: Dee H.

description: Cool decor but the food is awful.  I don't even recommend this place if you are drunk.  However, the owners are so nice I have to give them a star for their attention to their plants and a star for attention to their customers.
author: M S.

description:
I now live almost around the corner here. After move in day some late night Chinese food sounded pretty tasty.

Decor is nice and everytime I go in whoever is working is always super nice.

So far i'm a fan of the broccoli chicken, cashew chicken, chicken wings, veggie won ton soup and sweet and sour chicken. I guess I really like chicken.

I won't give this place 4 stars only because I haven't tried any other Chinese places around the area. I'll report back soon.
author: Amanda S.

description: Awful food, even worse service (rude AND dirty/grimy waiters). The only good things are that it's dirt cheap (explains why the above is so bad) and cute interior. But getting sick after is not worth it.
author: Anna S.

description:
I AM OBSESSED WITH WING LUM! The food is delicious and you never get any chunky weird pieces in the meat. They most ALWAYS throw in an extra side and the service is unbeatable. Don't let the fact that there is never anyone in here throw you off. I love their pork buns and even though its not on the menu they make the most amazing orange chicken ever. If I could give 6 stars to Wing Lum I would :D

ALSO, they're open super late which is convenient
author: Olivia G.

description:
This place is one of my favourite spots to get  Chinese food. The people are helpful and friendly and the food is hot and delicious.

But besides it being a place to get a quick meal, I suggest you walk around the restaurant and look at numerous fish tanks and plants. The plants are everywhere; it's as if you're reached a secret outpost in the middle of nowhere and the vegetation has taken over. 

Look for the small tree growing out of a coconut**. They're VERY proud of that plant! And, if you ask, you can even feed the Koi in the Koi pond.

[Update: 8/9/10 Wing Lum Cafe now serves dim sum]
[**Another Update 5/25/13 The tree growing out of a coconut has slowly pushed the coconut away. Ah, well, it was going to happen sooner or later. Still, there are other wonderful things to see and menu items to try at this place!]
author: Audrey S.

description:
Couldn't decide if I should be appreciative that they gave me the weekday lunch special pricing on the weekend, or be insulted when my request to have my prawns and veggies steamed was met with a "so you want to taste" response.

Let me do my thing lady.

Considering the generous amount of prawns, going with the glass half full.
author: Jason B.

description: I've been here a few times, and the food is pretty good. Very little interaction from the server. There are a few issues though. I've ordered several appetizers that were the same, but the server would deliver only 1 and count it as all of them. When one has a small portion. Also DO NOT let them box your leftover food to go. They took some of our food and left us with much smaller portions. I didn't discover this until I got home. I had a massive plate of chicken chow mein, and was only left with a box  that wasn't filled up. Very upsetting to know how much of a rip off this place really is. Definitely not going back.
author: Adrian M.

description: This has been my go-to Chinese food pretty much as long as I've lived here in SF.  I'm sure I'm biased because I'm vegan but I really dig the relatively large selection of veggie-friendly items.  And they always leave the egg out of my fried rice when I ask them to do so.  There are a number of places I've visited regularly for years, but I realize that this is a big city with a lot of people and so the number of places where I'm actually recognized as a 'regular' customer is only a handful.  This is one of those places and I really appreciate that.  Last word: once, they accidentally delivered me some beef dish with my order instead of whatever it was I'd ordered - they came back and got the beef and brought me my actual food in MINUTES, with sincere apologies.  I was really impressed.
author: Keegan R.

description: I am kinda a Chinese food snob, and this was not one of my favorite places. It was right around the corner from our hotel which made it convenient, but I left the restaurant disappointed. The decor seems to be internationally challenged with primarily Chinese themed decor but sprinkled with Mexican items and flags from all over the world. On the plus side, our server was extremely friendly and helpful, but he was not too attentive.
author: Mary M.

description:
We ordered the Szechuan Dinner for two. Not able to finish all the dishes in the dinner we asked if we could box it up to go. Our waiter (I think the owner, as he said he had been there for 14 years) offered to box it up himself and took our dishes to go box them. He returned with one semi-large bag. We thanked him for our time there and went home. The next day when I opened the food bag up for leftovers dinner I found that the majority of our food was missing.

Each of the take-out boxes were filled no more than halfway, when they each should have been overflowing, if not put in multiple boxes. We had barely touched the cashew chicken dish: one bite by each of us.

I called and asked about our predicament. The person on the phone remembered who I was and blamed us for the problem, explaining that we forgot the other food, that he threw it out this morning, and that if we had called earlier he would still have it. I asked how we could have forgotten it when he didn't bring it out to us. He then switched languages on me, and I couldn't understand what was said. To his credit when I told him I didn't understand he switched back to English.

From then on, he was very rude and hostile toward me saying over and over again that I had forgotten the food. I kept asking how this was possible as he only brought out one bag for us, and put it directly on the table. Seeing this was going nowhere, I told him to have a nice night and that I am sorry but I cannot return to his dishonest business.

What doesn't make sense to me if there was an extra bag (that he might have left in the back) was that we had four dishes to be boxed up: mongolian beef, cashew chicken, bbq pork fried rice, and won ton soup (he switched the soup in the Szechuan Dinner at the beginning when we ordered, as we asked)

The bag I received had one box for each of these dishes, but extremely small portions of each inside. If there had been another bag, it makes more sense to me that you would box one dish up at a time. So if a dish took up more than one box, those boxes would be filled before any of the other dishes were boxed up. Then I would put the boxes for one dish in a single bag, and only after running out of space in that bag (weight, volume), then I would get a second bag and put the rest of the dishes in there.

Because the bag I received had portions of all the dishes in it, it makes more sense to me that our waiter did not even box up the rest and decided not to give us our food. But maybe he just forgot to bring out the other bag.

Either way, he was extremely rude on the phone and dishonest about the situation, blaming me for a mistake he made. I will not be returning here, despite the comfortable aroma and pretty good food. There are plenty of other Chinese food restaurants in the area.
author: Cael H.

description:
To do it right: $10

At Wing Lum, booze-filled zombies shamble through the door as if they are entering a mall filled with survivors and the Chinese food there is brains.  As if unaware of their imminent, gruesome fate, the service remains chipper and polite. 

I had no intention of eating anything at the time, but when we walked out of McTeague's Saloon, Wing Lum shone like a beacon of open-at-1am-Chinese food awesomeness.

Once inside, I decided it was not a mirage, and split pork chow mein, twice cooked pork, and pork fried rice because we like variety.  The twice cooked pork was the only one of those that I might order again.

Summary: OK food, awesome hours/location.
author: Troy M.

description:
I'm always a little skeptical of Chinese food restaurants in San Francisco... but when my coworkers took me to Wing Lum for lunch, I was pleasantly surprised.

The portions are HUGE!!!! Two people can easily eat one dinner entree with a side of rice... and be full. Order any more and there's guaranteed to be leftovers.
 
I've gone there 3 times since then and been thoroughly impressed with the service and food!!!!
author: Landon S.

description:
Horrific. Never again!

Scallion Pancakes = Uncooked, gooey mess. 

Szechuan Beef = Corn starched gelatinous excuse for an entree.

Kung pao chicken = Tasteless chicken with mild sauce.
author: Dan E.

description: I came on a Thursday night around 7pm, there was not a single customer, which is a bad sign. Unfortunately it was too late to turn around. I ordered some take out. It was bad Chinese! Don't think I will visit it again.
author: Emmy P.

description:
At Wing Lum you'll find the same Chinese food as elsewhere. It's well executed (though globally a little bit too gelatinous) and the place has nice green plants everywhere.
The people are nice but they tend to try to sell you as much food as possible until you say no-thanks three times...
Service is fast and Ok.
author: Georges L.

description:
It's alright Chinese food at a great price -- problem is, there's a lot of competition at this price range and enough of it to prevent me from giving 4 stars. 

The General's chicken was good but not amazing, a little too sweet, another reviewer commented that they requested extra spicy, and I would recommend that as well.

The lunch special claims to have an appetizer, but they never actually served one. I was fine with this because the portions were already solid, but it was a bit of a let down.

All in all, for $7, it's good, but there are so many places nearby that I am not giving it a second shot until I check out more places. In this town there's no reason to settle for good when you can have amazing.
author: David H.

description:
Wing YUM!!!

Yeah! Mock chicken so mockin' good I stopped chewing for a second, thinking he got confused and gave me the real thing...

But then I remembered the real thing doesn't come in ball form.

Way to almost fake me out! While I was still SOBER!

Huge portions, too... Too bad I couldn't take the leftovers to the show I was seeing at the Hemlock. I had, like, an entire mock chicken left to eat. 

There are other mock animals on the menu here... I wasn't anticipating it being this good, so I held back (alright, I was saving calories for beer later on in the evening), but...

I SHALL RETURN.

I love the Hemlock, and Wing YUM is right across the street. You two should get married and make Lisa W.'s perfect-night-out-babies. Booze, mock meat, live music, hot eye candy with sweet arm tats, sizzling rice soup, and a smoking room...

OH WAIT -- I quit smoking, damnit. WHY CAN'T I ACCEPT THAT FACT?

But I don't EVER have to quit mock meat.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Well I eat a lot chinese in this price range.  I used to be a fan of a place up the street.... bamboo.... but after a while it just seemed I was getting disappointing meals there.   I hate it when planes use the chicken from the day before to make the gen chic. s/s chic etc.

So far,  wing lum has been pretty good for lunch.   they give you a won ton appetizer which, for plain old fried won tons,  they are super yum.   So far the gen chicken has been fresh.  I can tell when they make it fresh versus when tits from yesterday.  An asian freind of mine told me its fairly common for chinese places to cook up the deep fried chicken - without the sauces added, and use it the next day because the prep is time consuming.  When you oder gen chick, or s/s chic and its tough, or hard or too chewy - its yesterdays prep  reheated with today's sauce.

anyway I digress.     The little old lady who works here is always super nice.  and the dining room is clean and they have decent furniture, not like that typical gross linoleum floor and formica tables you usually get.  Now this isn't spectacular high end chinese.  its just typical, but so far, fresh, and friendly.  Ill keep going till they screw up. then Ill find another one.  hot and sour soup is good too.
author: J T.

description:
Feeling low, I decided to treat myself and spend the last few dollars in my wallet for take-out.  I chose Wing Lum after finding out that they actually serve faux meat.  I'm so close to this place, yet I've overlooked it until now.  

The fake meat was tough and dry, definitely not as good as Jasmine Tea House or Big Lantern, but it will suffice.  They get props just for offering it.  They have good dinner specials, and in typical Chinese food restaurant fashion, offer a page long list of lunch specials.  I wish they offered brown rice, but that's such a minor complaint.

I can only speak for take-out service, but it was friendly, not at all indifferent.  The portions are huge (one dinner entree is enough for two).  The interior was a lot more spacious than I had expected.  Count Wing Lum as another decent Chinese food place on Polk.
author: Marsha Z.

description: The garlic eggplant & dry fried string beans are really good. Didn't like the fake meat dishes much, though.
author: Wan T.

description:
They had a very interesting General's chicken at Wing Lum.  The sauce is served on the side, and the chicken has a really tasty seasoned coating.  By request, the sauce was nice and spicy, and had a great flavor.

So why the one star?

The chicken was not fresh.  I don't know how to describe it, but chicken gets a wierd flavor when reheated.  I know it wasn't fresh.  The egg roll had a similar un-freshness to it.

There was a broken toothpick stuck in one of the pieces of chicken covered in the fry-batter.  I can only hope that this was used in preperation, and that this dish wasn't someone's appetizer before mine.

The rest of the food is in my trash can.  

Bleck.

PS.  I ordered ONE egg roll and the guy gave me a whole ORDER of egg rolls.  Another 5 bucks down the drain.
author: Rocco B.

description: This restaurant has an authentic oriental decor.  Great place for late night munchies, and if one is craving for Chinese instead of pizza.  Quite a bit of take out while we were dining.  I liked the china used for our eating experience, as the plates were not cheapy looking but yet the prices were.  Although, the honey walnut prawns are pricey.  Sizzling rice soup was delicious...probably due to high amount of msg.  The shrimp chow fun was tasty as well.  Service was a bit slow, but it was on a holiday and the only place open on the block.  I would come back and try their lunch specials someday.
author: Christine R.

description:
Over the last few years, I've sporadically popped in here to order food. I don't think I've ever sat in here and judging from quite a few other reviews, I'm not in the minority. I don't think this should deter anyone from heading here but I wouldn't go and call this a destination either.

This restaurant definatly caters to many of us who are finding our wallets a little slim. Wing Lum offers a lunch special from 11am to 4pm everyday with over 60 entrees to choose as your main entree (none of which are over seven bucks, including appetizer, soup, rice and tea). Actually nearly every item on the menu is priced under the ten dollar mark and the amount you get is usually enough to feed one hungry person/ two people in need of substinance halfway through a Polk Street Bender. The appetizers have a slight edge over the entrees, plus they can be ordered in quantities in advance for a reasonable price (for all you lazy people facing holiday potlucks/ family gatherings). If you're ordering for delivery or to go for more than just yourself, dig around for a menu because the front has coupons for free food at the $20,$25 and $30 mark. All in all, it's ok; just nothing too special.
author: Veronica G.

description: I'm surprised to see so many good reviews for this place. The Chinese food is terrible. The meat is rubbery. The food is heavy and overly salty. I couldn't even finish eating it. There are definitely better Chinese restaurants in the area, like King Ling or Golden Horse.
author: Danielle D.

description:
Let me be clear on my experience at Wing Lum: 

1) I have never sat down to eat there.

2) In almost ten years I have ordered one item and one item only so I can't speak on anything else...

However: THEY HAVE THE BEST FRIED WON TONS IN THE CITY!!!

We're talking all meat (pork I think). Whenever I am going to a dinner party and need to bring a dish John the guy at that front always takes care of me and for around 30-40 bucks hooks me up with a HUGE dinner tray of won tons...

And any party a I go to these things area hit and people ask me where i got them.

TRY THE FRIED WON TONS!!! You won't be disappointed!
author: Patrick R.

description: I have been going to Wing Lum for years, they treat me like family and thats why I keep going back.  The food is very fresh and it feels like home when the sweet shy little waitress tells me i'm too skinny and brings me some great home made concoction out of the back!  The food always fills me up and tastes amazing, my friends and I can never finish everything!  My little 3 pound dog goes everywhere with me and they are always just as happy to see him as me and he knows he is getting a chicken treat! My dog gets just as excited to go to Wing Lum for dinner as I do!!!
author: Ryan W.

description:
We wound up here post-performance (meaning that we just left the symphony, now starving). The exterior is what attracted us to the place, and once we sat in the comfortable dining area, we knew that we chose wisely. 

I totally approved of two of our three entrees... while not very flavorful, the sauce and the ingredients were very low in sodium, which I appreciated. The beef was the most tender that any Chinese restaurant in the city can offer. 

I was appalled that during our meal, two of the carry-out customers did not have enough cash to pay for the tons of food they ordered, and the cashier simply conceded, letting them pay "next time."  Watch out buddy, you'll run a great restaurant out of business that way! 

We didn't try the faux-meat selections, but we did give them a compliment for offering these to vegetarians. The waiter reciprocated with very personal service and complimentary herbal tea.

... and the cute policeman sitting at the table next to us definitely helped the medicine go down.  ;)
author: Daniel C.

description:
this place is a gem in the rough. I would NEVER think to eat here if it wasn't for my cheap college friend. He always orders togo from them. Their food isn't spectacular or anything, but it's mildly cheap and BEYOND filling. And it's FAST... I can walk in, order, and within 5 minutes be walking out. I don't know if they should be a positive or not... but I enjoy it.

I have never sat and dined there, just ordered togo, but from what I see, there is normal chinese decor and quite a few tables. It's also open pretty late for late night chinese cravings.

Plus if you are bored... so many trannies to watch outside... which is one of my favorite pass times. Find the one with light-up heels and you get 10 points!!!
author: Preston B.

description:
i just had to back to wing lum for another lunch.   

and the kung pao chicken was fabulously tender spicy and glazed sweet;   the rice was steamed perfectly.  the fried wontons w/ sauce are just so addictive!!!!!!!
author: Paul N.

description: I love this place. Since I discovered Wing Lum Cafe I have been enjoying it every week. I'm not sure why this place isn't packed for dinner. They always bring the food out in a timely manner.  Some of the best Chinese food ever. The spicy eggplant is to die for and the imitation general Tso Chicken is great. Me and my good friend always get a free extra dish when we visit. They are so nice to us. They are open on Christmas, this is a good thing considering that I am new to the city.  Also this is a great place to bring a date because the atmosphere sets the mood!
author: Kendrick L.

description: on our first night after fly bar we knocked out and woke up around 10 pm lol. we were looking for a place to eat that was still opened and found this place. i got the won ton soup since i was feeling a bit drunk/nauseus/etc and my boyfriend go the peking duck. the soup definitely helped me stomach out and it was really good. the duck was great, but there was a bit too much fat on it and not enough meat. i wish that it was a bit better...but still worth it. the price is also reasonable. a good place to check out if you're in the neighborhood and in the mood for some chinese food :]
author: Ashley H.

description: This has got to be one of the worst customer service restaurants in San Francisco, you will sit there for 20minutes before anyone decides to get off their butts and take your order....the place is always empty.....during the day...the chinese woman who works there is totally rude.. she doesn't like you to look at her menu to long ... she freaks out ...would NOT recommend this this chinese restaurant to ANYONE who loves chinese food go elsewhere....you'll enjoy yourself more......
author: Brittney M.

description:
I gave it a 3 stars just because it was a fast delivery under 30minutes.
I was craving for some honey walnut prawns for lunch at work... 
Anyways, what annoys me the most is that in their takeout menu, the walnut prawns is $10 and the steamed rice .75 cents. But it ended up $16.25... My thought was "why is it so expensive for 2 items?" after i paid, i realized they charged me for an extra item that i did not item. Which was a bowl of soup... unless it comes for free... but still..  
overall, my shrimp was fresh but the fortune cookie was stale =( 
Next time, if i ever order out, I'll make sure what the cost is... or else, I'll feel ripped off again.
author: Selina L.

description:
Another average spot to me, but had three teenage chinese boys arm-wrestling at the first table. My friend that recommended this other amazing chinese restaurant totally got my hopes up with this one.

Pros: clean, good portions for the price

Cons: not so hot service, and the possibility of getting your car stolen if you can't see it from the restaurant.

if you're in the neighborhood and you're hungry, you won't be disappointed, but... don't go out of your way to eat here.
author: kim l.

description:
I've been going to Wing Lum for the last three years. It started out as delivery, and then I discovered the fantastic dining room. 

Wing Lum provides SF Chinese at it's best: great portions, fresh vegetables and meats, their seitan is pretty darn good and the in-house service is amazing.

They give generous portions - and if you are a regular customer, they will generally throw in a lot of extra stuff, like appetizers, etc. 

My personal favourites are the BBQ Pork Chow Mein and Sweet & Sour Seitan.
author: Stephen M.

description:
Was in the mood for Chinese, glad I chose this one.  My waitress was a sweet old lady who kept me posted on how soon my food was coming.  I started w/ a bowl of wonton soup, but not like the kind I used to get in NY w/ 3 wontons and tiny shreds of pork.  This soup was $5.50 worth with about 6 or 7 wontons and a bunch of veggies in a big bowl.  It was definitely satisfying.

This place is suited more for 2 or more people, they have pretty big portions.  I came alone though so I was practically full from my soup when they brought out the Chicken House Special I ordered w/ rice.
