Delicious, and the lady pointed out the Chinese shittake mushrooms in it maybe because she could tell I was half-Japanese.  This also hit the spot, spicy and delicious.
author: Teddy H.

description: New Year's Day and I'm out with some friends celebrating and we somehow decide upon dim sum. And after a night out we weren't keen on trekking over to Chinatown so this place just had to suffice. You know what though, this place isn't too shabby. The dim sum could have been a little better or more varied, but it tides one over for a bit. Don't let the slim pickings for dim sum deter you. Of the dishes we selected all of them were pretty tasty. The service was a bit on the slow side but they are also apologetic to that fact but overall it was pretty standard.
author: Shauna S.

description: This place is pretty cool. The interior design is really cool and the fact that they are open until midnight is pretty rockin. Wing Lum has hands down the best fried rice I've had in my life. The service was a little  negligent which surprised me, seeing as my boyfriend and I were the only customers in the restaurant. It took about 30 minutes after we finished eating to get our check. But hey, if you're down to make a whole night out of dinner, definitely check this place out.
author: Nikki P.

description:
Dim Sum Bar was OUT of dim-sum tonight, if you can believe it.  The girl at the counter said they'd had a big party earlier or something.  Cleaned them out.  "Shouldn't you close up shop or go by some other name until this condition is remedied?  I mean you are 'DIM SUM Bar', for chrissake!".  I couldn't help but be a bit of an ass.  This put a logistical wrench in my dinner mission.  I still had to pick up a Vietnamese sandwich at Lees for Lauren C on Larkin and Ellis, so I could hardly roam very far in pursuit of my own dim-sum cravings.  But a few days ago, I'd noticed "Dim Sum all day" signs had appeared taped up inside the windows of Wing Lum on Sutter and Polk.  Fate!  I'd never set foot in the place before tonight, though I've been walking past it for years.  Way too much Chinese fanfare for the Tenderloin, if you know what I mean.  But tonight, it's all good.  I make my way up the four steps that elevate the establishment, by a small but meaningful degree, above the level of the street.  Inside, it's movie-set thick with ambiance, alright.  Bright lucky Chinese red painted interior.  The fog-machine exoticism of large epiphytes hanging from the ceiling in clay pots crusted with lichen that drip moisture into the koi pond below.  A serpent of Christmas lights coils about the stone feet of Eastern deities.  There are small aquariums throughout the restaurant that glow like green lanterns at tableside and teem with baby guppies amidst glaucous algal blooms.  Nice.  Clearly there is a fair amount of positive radiation keeping all this shit flourishing and alive.  I know about how fish tanks and plants are a gauge of the health of the house.  So I am prepared to love this place from the moment I step inside. A smiling Chinese woman comes forward to greet me. "I came in for the dim-sum!", I announce. A Chinese man looks up from the kitchen through a window in the wall and makes approving eye contact with me.  "I saw the signs..."   I want to make sure they know why I'm here.  I want to be a reward to their efforts.

The new dim-sum offering at Wing Lum is great, and you should avail yourself enthusiastically of this new source of 'sum in the Loin, if that's your thing.  But this glowing review owes more to the nourishment I took for the soul.  "Thanks Wing Lum dudes for your awesome and unselfconscious expression of entrepreneurial optimism.  Thanks for having the courage to reinvent yourself in uncertain times.  Be encouraged!  Make your signs larger and more colorful."
author: Jack M.

description: I ordered some general taos chicken for delivery at my hotel.. w/ the steam rice ,  they did get it to my room very fast  and it was hot.. as for the taste of the food.. it was just alright.. i should have proberly orderd  the sweet and sour chicken.. it was very very spicy . i wanted it mild , i ask for it mild but i guess they could not make it that way..
author: Attaicus C.

description: This place is wonderful, dining in is relaxing, love the plants and waterfall fishpond, delivery is really fast! The prices are perfect, very affordable, and the food is GREAT! Try the potstickers and eggrolls here! Try the Tomato Beef Chow Mein and their General Chao Chicken and DO NOT!!! Forget the Dry Fried String Beans. Love them. They are very good to their regulars, dining in today they remembered this was one of our favorites and brought us a hot heaping plate of them on the house with a smile :) the darlings! also they have a good selection of seafood dishes, all at good prices as per usual with this place. I really recommend dining here if u are in the neighborhood!
author: Mia D.

description: This is now our go-to local chinese delivery place.  They also have good lunch specials.  I'm a big fan of the Chef's Special Beef and the Chef's Special Chicken.  My girlfriend loves the Hot & Sour soup.  There are specials you can see on the menu in one of the pics
author: Eric R.

description:
First off, the appetizers are excellent!!  Its been the first affordable Chinese food place that actually stuffs their starters!  
I overate the fried rice & was pleasantly surprised at the spices in Hunan Chicken (sauce to die for).  All this good eatin' while cooked promptly.  They deliver quick too, but the interior restaurant is very nice & comfortable.
author: McCracken C.

description: Wing Lums Chinese food is so delicious.. I love there chicken friend rice, chicken chow mein, fried calamari, fried won ton.. There fried calamari is awesome.. Also if you order more than $20 or more they give free other appetizers or like free chow mein, fried rice or kung pao chicken..
author: RICHARD W.

description: I spent this past Christmas with Kia B. here for dinner and so it will always be my favorite "Chinese Restaurant."  The won ton soup is excellent and all the ingredients are fresh.  Love the fish tanks and the service.
author: Corey V.

description: Everything comes out the way it is described, piping hot, huge portions and reasonable prices. Not too greasy, and full of MSG! Best drunken chinese food excursion, like, ever.
author: Y K.

description: If you like bland, overpriced Chinese food then this is the spot for you!!!  Hit this joint up last night after having a few drinks with a friend.  We ordered the usual salt and pepper porkchops (which is a chef's "special" on their menu) and the beef w/oyster sauce.  Now, mind you, I don't expect much from a Chinese restaurant these days.  I expect bad wait staffs, less than sanitary conditions, and cooks that I wouldn't want to eat from if I actually saw them in-person.  But one thing I do expect from a Chinese restaurant is this thing called, umm...flavor!!!  Flavor is that thing that sort of spreads around and gets absorbed into your taste buds when you put something in your mouth.  Well our dishes lacked this key component.  The beef w/oyster sauce was craphole bland and the salt and pepper spareribs had neither a salty nor peppery flavor going on.  Keep in mind here folks that it's 12:30 in the morning and we're trying to sober up from the drinks we'd had earlier that night.  So if this place can't satisfy my low expectations in a state of semi-drunken hunger, then you know it's bad.  Save your money and go elsewhere.  Even the Subway on the corner stays open late so maybe a $5 footlong is a better choice.
author: D L.

description: I work for an after school program in the Tenderloin and we order a lot from Wing Lum for our family resource meetings with parents. The general consensus was that the food here is excellent-- especially the eggplant in spicy sauce and the chicken chow mein. You must asking why the one star then? My co-worker told me that our family resource coordinator was yelled at by the owner of this restaurant. She had offered to go to the restaurant and settle our account HOWEVER he stated that only our program manager  (who was out sick) could so because unlike other times this was a large amount. To sum it up, he was being an ahole since (his own fault) he wasn't being paid today. We immediately cancelled our order for tomorrow night. This is not how you do business. I work for a non-profit and we've had a good relationship with them up until now obviously. Do yourself (and I) a favor... take your business elsewhere. I
author: selina n.

description: I just got the worst food poisoning of my life from this place. Chow mein and I only took two bites.
author: Jackson H.

description: Not sure why the husband keeps insisting from ordering here... yes, it's fairly priced but it's a sticky mess of salt with food that fills up the belly fast if that's all you want. Works for some and he obviously loves it, but just doesn't do it for me.
author: Nenette Y.

description:
Ok...General Tso's Chicken or Shrimp Rocks!!!  They don't sauce it at the restaurant...so it arrives GBD(Golden Brown Delicious).  The sauce is great..although I reccomend thinning it a bit with soy or the like and dipping instead of slathering it on.  Sweet & Spicy and totally yummy.

Down side...soups are a little thick...corn starchy thick.  Not a pleasant mouth feel.  Wow, was that pretentious?
author: RJ O.

description: I have to add I am in LOVE with their Hunan General Chicken, they bring it to you, the pieces of tender fried chicken and the sauce in a separate container (which is fun if you're like me and love to eat with your fingers), it is so yummy..I love their Combination Fried Rice as well and I rarely order fried rice because being part Asian myself, i have always been the type to order steamed rice and just pour whatever else I ordered with it on top of the rice.  Their Combination Fried Rice has BIG shrimps in it..not little baby ones like most restaurants use in their fried rice... Wing Lum rocks my socks!!! THEY ARE TOPS!! I have ordered from them since 2001 and they have delivered to me everywhere from Critical Path & 1st and Folsom to the T-L, to the lower Castro area..
author: Sakkara C.

description: Passing by this restaurant seems fairly nice on the outside, the inside is tastfully decorated with oriental art and tropical flora. As a restaurant that we just passed by and took a chance on, I would say it was a pretty good choice. The server didn't seem to be very much of a conversationalist but service was pretty prompt and food came out hot. We ordered the fried rice since it was recommended; have to say not the best I've had but it was definatly freshly prepared since it came out piping hot. We ordered the curried chicken, chicken chow mein, and kung pao pork, all of which were very well prepared and I would recommend all of them. Final word, you could always find better in Chinatown but this place makes it pretty darn good...
author: Andrew M.

description:
dear wing lum,

thanks for the awesome delivery service. you always make it in under 20 minutes or less so the goodies arrive HOT. plus, you always give me complimentary egg rolls, stuffed with delightful veggies, if i order more than $20-worth of food. thanks for that as well!

i think my faves from your kitchen are actually the typical american-style chinese fare: mu shu veggies, kung pao chicken, and shrimp chow mein. i'm not going to venture outside of my comfort zone with you just yet because you really just serve one purpose for me: you give me freshly-prepared food when i have had a long day and don't feel like spending too much time or money at a nicer establishment. even though i don't place you first in the food race, you definitely bring up the rear nicely. for that, i can not thank you enough.

kind regards,

may t.
author: May T.

description: This place is AMAZING!!! The food is always great, the service is even better, and if you come often enough food that you didn't order shows up with your food. It's a bit cold sometimes, but totally over-lookable. Overall delicious!
author: Chris B.

description: I ordered an orange shrimp and it came with a FLY floating in the sauce! Nuf' said.
author: John S.

description:
As far as your medium price and quality Chinese food restaurants go, this is my favorite in the neighborhood. They are the one asian food place I know that actually knows how to make good, tender and tasty meats (monglian beef and lemon chicken are great!)  The staff was also very nice, the decor is entertaining and the prices are average. 

If you want to splurge, try the $22 bottle of hot sake.  It went down really well on a rainy day.

Enjoy.
author: Richard H.

description: Had it for delivery, so can only comment on the food.  It had lots of MSG and not a lot of tasted. There are far better Chinese places in the Tenderloin.
author: K. B.

description: I love Wing Lum. When my parents come to town they always insist on eating there. Everyone is so friendly and the prices are perfect. Best Wonton Soup in the City.
author: Aimee G.

description: My husband has been frequenting this place for 8 years. When we met 5 years ago it quickly became a regular spot for the both of us. We love the fried rice, duck, orange chicken and salt and pepper prawns. John the main guy there is the best and the servers will always remember you and what you like to order time after time. So with all this said we definitely recommend thus place!!
author: Brooke P.

description: This really isn't like the "best" chinese food in the city but its really not that bad and you get so much.  I have never been inside the place i just order take out.  For 7 bucks you get a lot and they always have this special where if you order $20 worth of stuff you can get some free chow mein or fried rice.  Not to bad if you go in with like 3 or 4 friends.  This review is solely based off food quality.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
this was some of the best chinese i have had in a while.  

headed over for dinner, before my friend's show at the hemlock.  which is right across the street.  i saw the place and it looked... eclectic.  lots of plants in the entry way and big windows... and chinese sounded good, so i insisted that we go.

didn't get anything exciting, stuck to the (white girl eating chinese) classics: sweet and sour chicken, beef with snow peas, bbq pork fried rice and vegetable chow mein.  this ended up being JUST too much food for 3 of us.  

the sweet and sour chicken was delicious.  crispy chicken, gooey yummy sauce. the beef with snow peas was wached out tasting, but i figured it would be.  and the chow mein was fantastic, it was a little greasy... but not nearly as heavy as most places make it.

service was nothing spectacular, although we had a difficult time understanding the woman who served us, but she tried and pointing seemed to work very well... and she smiled.  it's definitely not a place to go if you are in a hurry.  prices are average chinese food prices, with the usual generous portions.  the bill was $31.

we all remarked how normallly after chinese food, is tummy ache city.  but not here.  even though we ate to the brim there was no greasy tummy ache.  just pure satisfaction.

i will definitely be back.
author: Ge O.

description: This place never lets me down! Especially after walking down Polk street late at night to satisfy my chinese food craving. Every dish I had has been delicious and satisfying. My favorite is the won ton soup and the chow mein and Tiger beer! The staff are always great and remember my friends and I every time we stumble in their beautifully decorated entrance. The atmosphere is welcoming and very zen. The prices aren't bad either. They're open late which is another plus. I definitely go out of my way to come to this restaurant, in fact I went there this morning for brunch and the woman who served us was such a sweetheart, I love her! The guy, Joe.. (or is it John?) always remembers us and seats us at our favorite table. I will always be a returning customer to this place and I highly recommend it if you want cheap, delicious chinese food ANYTIME! I'm very picky with my Chinese food but this place hits the spot!
author: April V.

description: I ordered delivery from here and they were fast and polite.  They included an extra order of chicken lo mein, which was a pleasant surprise.  The food is not great, but it is cheap and convenient.
author: Eric W.

description: great deal luch specails are really cheap and awesome even regular priced stuff is pretty cheap , they ahve a good selection of vegeterian stuff too you can get alot of stuff with fake chicken. the owner guy is really nice too been going here for a long time will keep going fuck yeah wing lum!! lum it up!
author: lord v.

description: greasy,  cheap, and fast free delivery (i live closeby but it's always hot  when it gets here.) when i first moved here i was getting the especially greasy egg rolls delivered daily. to my bed.
author: aerin w.

description: It's more of a 3.5 star kinda place.  I work in the Pac heights and get kinda lazy sometimes for food. Especially on a cold day like Monday.  Sitting in my office I am wondering where to get food from.  So I find my menu from Wing Lum and get my usual.  The special wonton soup...its nothing spectacular but with 3 packets of tabasco sauce....it was freaking awesome.  The soup with filled with wonton, chicken, beef, shrimp and tons of veggies.  Truly hit the spot.  The only bad part was they deliver for a minimum of $10...so I had to get me another order.  I ended up getting the lunch special beef with mix veggies over rice.  That was a huge order....no Ms. Piggy I did not eat it all I did take a few samples.  I ended up eating it for lunch the next day and it was not bad....I did use a lot of hotsauce...I sure do like my stuff spicy.  Well for my 2 order I also got a free soup, fried wonton and a free soda....what a deal.  I definitely will order again but only when I am feeling too lazy to walk out.
author: Allison T.

description: What a gamble, we have done take out 4 times now and sometimes it is amazing and sometimes it sucks. But it is those amazing times that makes us roll the dice again.
author: JA C.

description: Just discovered this place. Since I needed to be in the area two nights in a row I actually ate there twice.  Great value for money.  It's got little atmosphere but the food is about the best at that price point I've seen. I had both the chicken corn soup and the wonton soup.  A $5 bowl could easily serve 3 or 4.  The moo shu shrimp had real shrimp you could see and taste.   I had the kung pao chicken the previous night and it was quite tasty.  A couple of comments about real vs. gnarly chicken in earlier reviews.  I'm a stickler for this kind of thing and I had real chicken in both the soups and main course I ordered.    This place is reasonable, quick and has very decent  food.  And the manager, John, was very solicitious and friendly.  Give it s shot.
author: David F.

description: I have to say, the food is average to good for cheap chinese. I got to go service (ok so it was like 1145 for a post booty snack, so i should be more greatful they were still open), but the man never told me my total and hung up the phone without letting me give him my credit card number, then i called back and they said they were closed, and i was like ok let me give you my credit card, and he hung up. 30 minutes later wonderboy shows up with my sweet n sour chicken and my bill, i say cool heres my credit card #, he says no. so i have to have him call his boss.. and yada yada yada. but shit was that some good sweet n sour chicken;
author: mike s.
